data.author: Threepio
data.text: Did you hear that?  They've shut down the main reactor.  We'll be destroyed for sure.  This is madness!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: We're doomed!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: There'll be no escape for the Princess this time.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: What's that?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I should have known better than to trust the logic of a half-sized thermocapsulary dehousing assister...

data.author: Luke
data.text: Hurry up!  Come with me!  What are you waiting for?!  Get in gear!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Artoo! Artoo-Detoo, where are you?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: At last!  Where have you been?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: They're heading in this direction. What are we going to do?  We'll be sent to the spice mines of Kessel or smashed into who knows what!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Wait a minute, where are you going?

data.author: Imperial Officer
data.text: The Death Star plans are not in the main computer.

data.author: Vader
data.text: Where are those transmissions you intercepted?

data.author: Rebel Officer
data.text: We intercepted no transmissions. Aaah...  This is a consular ship. Were on a diplomatic mission.

data.author: Vader
data.text: If this is a consular ship... where is the Ambassador?

data.author: Vader
data.text: Commander, tear this ship apart until you've found those plans and bring me the Ambassador.  I want her alive!

data.author: Trooper
data.text: There she is! Set for stun!

data.author: Trooper
data.text: She'll be all right. Inform Lord Vader we have a prisoner.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Hey, you're not permitted in there.  It's restricted. You'll be deactivated for sure..

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Don't call me a mindless philosopher, you overweight glob of grease!  Now come out before somebody sees you.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Secret mission?  What plans?  What are you talking about?  I'm not getting in there!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I'm going to regret this.

data.author: Chief Pilot
data.text: There goes another one.

data.author: Captain
data.text: Hold your fire.  There are no life forms.  It must have been short-circuited.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: That's funny, the damage doesn't look as bad from out here.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Are you sure this things safe?

data.author: Woman
data.text: I've told you kids to slow down!

data.author: Fixer
data.text: Did I hear a young noise blast through here?

data.author: Camie
data.text: It was just Wormie on another rampage.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Shape it up you guys!...  Biggs?

data.author: Luke
data.text: I didn't know you were back!  When did you get in?

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Just now.  I wanted to surprise you, hot shot.  I thought you'd be here... certainly didn't expect you to be out working.

data.author: Luke
data.text: The Academy didn't change you much... but you're back so soon?  Hey, what happened, didn't you get your commission?

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Of course I got it.  Signed aboard The Rand Ecliptic last week.  First mate Biggs Darklighter at your service...... I just came back to say goodbye to all you unfortunate landlocked simpletons.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I almost forgot.  There's a battle going on!  Right here in our system.  Come and look!

data.author: Deak
data.text: Not again!  Forget it.

data.author: Luke
data.text: There they are!

data.author: Biggs
data.text: That's no battle, hot shot... they're just sitting there!  Probably a freighter-tanker refueling.

data.author: Luke
data.text: But there was a lot of firing earlier...

data.author: Luke
data.text: Hey, easy with those...

data.author: Camie
data.text: Don't worry about it, Wormie.

data.author: Fixer
data.text: I keep telling you, the Rebellion is a long way from here.  I doubt if the Empire would even fight to keep this system.  Believe me Luke, this planet is a big hunk of nothing...

data.author: Leia
data.text: Lord Vader, I should have known.  Only you could be so bold.  The Imperial Senate will not sit stillfor this, when they hear you've attacked a diplomatic...

data.author: Vader
data.text: Don't play games with me, Your Highness.  You weren't on any mercy mission this time.  You passed directly through a restricted system.  Several transmissions were beamed to this ship by Rebel spies.  I want to know what happened to the plans they sent you.

data.author: Leia
data.text: I don't know what you're talking about.  I'm a member of the Imperial Senate on a diplomatic mission to Alderaan...

data.author: Vader
data.text: You're a part of the Rebel Alliance... and a traitor.  Take her away!

data.author: Commander
data.text: Holding her is dangerous.  If word of this gets out, it could generate sympathy for the Rebellion in the senate.

data.author: Vader
data.text: I have traced the Rebel spies to her.  Now she is my only link to find their secret base!

data.author: Commander
data.text: you anything.

data.author: Vader
data.text: Leave that to me.  Send a distress signal and then inform the senate that all aboard were killed!

data.author: Second Officer
data.text: Lord Vader, the battle station plans are not aboard this ship!  And no transmissions were made.  An escape pod was jettisoned during the fighting, but no life forms were aboard.

data.author: Vader
data.text: She must have hidden the plans in the escape pod.  Send a detachment down to retrieve them.  See to it personally, Commander.  There'll be no one to stop us this time.

data.author: Commander
data.text: Yes, sir.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: How did I get into this mess?  I really don't know how.  We seem to be made to suffer.  It's our lot in life.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I've got to rest before I fall apart.  My joints are almost frozen.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: What a desolate place this is.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Where are you going?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Well, I'm not going that way.  It's much too rocky.  This way is much easier.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: What makes you think there are settlements over there?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Don't get technical with me.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: What mission?  What are you talking about?  I've had just about enough of you!  Go that way!  You'll be malfunctioning within a day, you nearsighted scrap pile!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: And don't let me catch you following me begging for help, because you won't get it.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: No more adventures.  I'm not going that way.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: That malfunctioning little twerp.  This is all his fault!  He tricked me into going this way, but he'll do no better.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Wait, what's that?  A transport!  I'm saved!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Over here!  Help!  Please, help!

data.author: Luke
data.text: ... so I cut off my power, shut down the afterburners and came in low on Deak's trail.  I was so close I thought I was going to fry my instruments. As it was I busted up the Skyhopper pretty bad.  Uncle Owen was pretty upset.  He grounded me for the rest of the season.  You should have been there... it was fantastic.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: You ought to take it a little easy Luke.  You may be the hottest bushpilot this side of Mos Eisley, but those little Skyhoppers are dangerous.  Keep it up, and one day, whammo, you're going to be nothing more than a dark spot on the down side of a canyon wall.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Look who's talking.  Now that you've been around those giant starships you're beginning to sound like my uncle. You've gotten soft in the city...

data.author: Biggs
data.text: I've missed you kid.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Well, things haven't been the same since you left, Biggs.  It's been so...quiet.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Luke, I didn't come back just to say goodbye...  I shouldn't tell you this, but you're the only one I can trust... and if I don't come back, I want somebody to know.

data.author: Luke
data.text: What are you talking about?

data.author: Biggs
data.text: I made some friends at the Academy. ... when our frigate goes to one of the central systems, we're going to jump ship and join the Alliance...

data.author: Luke
data.text: Join the Rebellion?!  Are you kidding!  How?

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Quiet down will ya!  You got a mouth bigger than a meteor crater!

data.author: Luke
data.text: I'm sorry.  I'm quiet. Listen how quiet I am.  You can barely hear me...

data.author: Biggs
data.text: My friend has a friend on Bestine who might help us make contact.

data.author: Luke
data.text: around forever trying to find them.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: I know it's a long shot, but if I don't find them I'll do what I can on my own...  It's what we always talked about.  Luke, I'm not going to wait for the Empire to draft me into service.  The Rebellion is spreading and I want to be on the right side - the side I believe in.

data.author: Luke
data.text: And I'm stuck here...

data.author: Biggs
data.text: I thought you were going to the Academy next term.  You'll get your chance to get off this rock.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Not likely!  I had to cancel my application.  There has been a lot of unrest among the Sand People since you left... they've even raided the outskirts of Anchorhead.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Your uncle could hold off a whole colony of Sand People with one blaster.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I know, but he's got enough vaporators going to make the place pay off.  He needs me for just one more season.  I can't leave him now.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: I feel for you, Luke, you're going to have to learn what seems to be important or what really is important.  What good is all your uncle's work if it's taken over by the Empire?...  You know they're starting to nationalize commerce in the central systems...it won't be long before your uncle is merely a tenant, slaving for the greater glory of the Empire.

data.author: Luke
data.text: It couldn't happen here.  You said it yourself.  The Empire won't bother with this rock.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Things always change.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I wish I was going...  Are you going to be around long?

data.author: Biggs
data.text: No, I'm leaving in the morning...

data.author: Luke
data.text: Then I guess I won't see you.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Maybe someday...  I'll keep a lookout.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Well, I'll be at the Academy next season... after that who knows.  I won't be drafted into the Imperial Starfleet that's for sure...  Take care of yourself, you'll always be the best friend I've got.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: So long, Luke.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Artoo-Detoo!  It's you!  It's you!

data.author: First Trooper
data.text: Someone was in the pod.  The tracks go off in this direction.

data.author: Second Trooper
data.text: Look, sir - droids.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Wake up!  Wake up!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: We're doomed.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Do you think they'll melt us down?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Don't shoot!  Don't shoot!  Will this never end?

data.author: Beru
data.text: Luke, tell Owen that if he gets a translator to be sure it speaks Bocce.

data.author: Luke
data.text: It looks like we don't have much of a choice but I'll remind him.

data.author: Owen
data.text: I have no need for a protocol droid.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Sir - not in an environment such as this - that's why I've also been programmed for over thirty secondary functions that...

data.author: Owen
data.text: What I really need is a droid that understands the binary languages of moisture vaporators.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Vaporators!  Sir - My first job was programming binary load lifters... very similar to your vaporators.  You could say...

data.author: Owen
data.text: Do you speak Bocce?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Of course I can, sir.  It's like a second language for me...  I'm as fluent in Bocce...

data.author: Owen
data.text: All right

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Shutting up, sir.

data.author: Owen
data.text: Luke, take these two over to the garage, will you?  I want you to have both of them cleaned up before dinner.

data.author: Luke
data.text: But I was going into Toshi Station to pick up some power converters...

data.author: Owen
data.text: You can waste time with your friends when your chores are done.  Now, come on, get to it!

data.author: Luke
data.text: All right, come on!  And the red one, come on.  Well, come on, Red, let's go.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Uncle Owen...

data.author: Owen
data.text: Yeah?

data.author: Luke
data.text: This R2 unit has a bad motivator.  Look!

data.author: Owen
data.text: Hey, what're you trying to push on us?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Excuse me, sir, but that R2 unit is in prime condition.  A real bargain.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Uncle Owen...

data.author: Owen
data.text: Yeah?

data.author: Luke
data.text: What about that one?

data.author: Owen
data.text: What about that blue one?  We'll take that one.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Yeah, take it away.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Uh, I'm quite sure you'll be very pleased with that one, sir.  He really is in first-class condition.  I've worked with him before.  Here he comes.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Okay, let's go.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Now, don't forget this!  Why I should stick my neck out for you is quite beyond my capacity!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Thank the maker!  This oil bath is going to feel so good.  I've got such a bad case of dust contamination, I can barely move!

data.author: Luke
data.text: It just isn't fair.  Oh, Biggs is right.  I'm never gonna get out of here!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Is there anything I might do to help?

data.author: Luke
data.text: Well, not unless you can alter time, speed up the harvest, or teleport me off this rock!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I don't think so, sir.  I'm only a droid and not very knowledgeable about such things.  Not on this planet, anyways.  As a matter of fact, I'm not even sure which planet I'm on.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Well, if there's a bright center to the universe, you're on the planet that it's farthest from.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I see, sir.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Uh, you can call me Luke.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I see, sir Luke.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Just Luke.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: And I am See-Threepio, human-cyborg relations, and this is my counterpart, Artoo-Detoo.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Hello.

data.author: Luke
data.text: You got a lot of carbon scoring here.  It looks like you boys have seen a lot of action.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: With all we've been through, sometimes I'm amazed we're in as good condition as we are, what with the Rebellion and all.

data.author: Luke
data.text: You know of the Rebellion against the Empire?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: That's how we came to be in your service, if you take my meaning, sir.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Have you been in many battles?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Several, I think.  Actually, there's not much to tell.  I'm not much more than an interpreter, and not very good at telling stories.  Well, not at making them interesting, anyways.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Well, my little friend, you've got something jammed in here real good.  Were you on a starcruiser or...

data.author: Leia
data.text: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi.  You'remy only hope.

data.author: Luke
data.text: What's this?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: What is what?!?  He asked you a question...What is that?

data.author: Leia
data.text: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi.  You're my only hope.  Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi.  You're my only hope.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Oh, he says it's nothing, sir.  Merely a malfunction.  Old data.  Pay it no mind.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Who is she?  She's beautiful.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I'm afraid I'm not quite sure, sir.

data.author: Leia
data.text: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi...

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I think she was a passenger on our last voyage.  A person of some importance, sir - I believe.  Our captain was attached to...

data.author: Luke
data.text: Is there more to this recording?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Behave yourself, Artoo.  You're going to get us in trouble.  It's all right, you can trust him.  He's our new master.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: He says he's the property of Obi-Wan Kenobi, a resident of these parts.  And it's a private message for him.  Quite frankly, sir, I don't know what he's talking about.  Our last master was Captain Antilles, but with what we've been through, this little R2 unit has become a bit eccentric.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Obi-Wan Kenobi?  I wonder if he means old Ben Kenobi?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I beg your pardon, sir, but do you know what he's talking about?

data.author: Luke
data.text: Well, I don't know anyone named Obi-Wan, but old Ben lives out beyond the dune sea.  He's kind of a strange old hermit.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I wonder who she is.  It sounds like she's in trouble.  I'd better play back the whole thing.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: He says the restraining bolt has short circuited his recording system.  He suggests that if you remove the bolt, he might be able to play back the entire recording.

data.author: Luke
data.text: H'm?  Oh, yeah, well, I guess you're too small to run away on me if I take this off!  Okay.

data.author: Luke
data.text: There you go.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Well, wait a minute.  Where'd she go?  Bring her back!  Play back the entire message.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: been playing.  The one you're carrying inside your rusty innards!

data.author: Aunt Beru
data.text: Luke?  Luke!  Come to dinner!

data.author: Luke
data.text: All right, I'll be right there, Aunt Beru.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I'm sorry, sir, but he appears to have picked up a slight flutter.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Well, see what you can do with him.  I'll be right back.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Just you reconsider playing that message for him.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: No, I don't think he likes you at all.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: No, I don't like you either.

data.author: Luke
data.text: You know, I think that R2 unit we bought might have been stolen.

data.author: Owen
data.text: What makes you think that?

data.author: Luke
data.text: Well, I stumbled across a recording while I was cleaning him.  He says he belongs to someone called Obi-Wan Kenobi.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I thought he might have meant Ben.  Do you know what he's talking about?  Well, I wonder if he's related to Ben.

data.author: Owen
data.text: That old man's just a crazy wizard.  Tomorrow I want you to take that R2 unit into Anchorhead and have its memory flushed.  That'll be the end of it.  It belongs to us now.

data.author: Luke
data.text: But what if this Obi-Wan comes looking for him?

data.author: Owen
data.text: He won't, I don't think he exists any more.  He died about the same time as your father.

data.author: Luke
data.text: He knew my father?

data.author: Owen
data.text: I told you to forget it.  Your only concern is to prepare the new droids for tomorrow.  In the morning I want them on the south ridge working out those condensers.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Yes, sir.  I think those new droids are going to work out fine.  In fact, I, uh, was also thinking about our agreement about my staying on another season.  And if these new droids do work out, I want to transmit my application to the Academy this year.

data.author: Owen
data.text: You mean the next semester before harvest?

data.author: Luke
data.text: Sure, there're more than enough droids.

data.author: Owen
data.text: Harvest is when I need you the most.  Only one more season.  This year we'll make enough on the harvest so I'll be able to hire some more hands.  And then you can go to the Academy next year.

data.author: Owen
data.text: You must understand I need you here, Luke.

data.author: Luke
data.text: But it's a whole 'nother year.

data.author: Owen
data.text: Look, it's only one more season.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Yeah, that's what you said last year when Biggs and Tank left.

data.author: Aunt Beru
data.text: Where are you going?

data.author: Luke
data.text: It looks like I'm going nowhere.  I have to finish cleaning those droids.

data.author: Aunt Beru
data.text: Owen, he can't stay here forever.  Most of his friends have gone.  It means so much to him.

data.author: Owen
data.text: I'll make it up to him next year.  I promise.

data.author: Aunt Beru
data.text: Luke's just not a farmer, Owen.  He has too much of his father in him.

data.author: Owen
data.text: That's what I'm afraid of.

data.author: Luke
data.text: What are you doing hiding there?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: It wasn't my fault, sir.  Please don't deactivate me.  I told him not to go, but he's faulty, malfunctioning

data.author: Luke
data.text: Oh, no!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: That R2 unit has always been a problem.  These astro-droids are getting quite out of hand.  Even I can't understand their logic at times.

data.author: Luke
data.text: How could I be so stupid?  He's nowhere in sight.  Blast it!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Pardon me, sir, but couldn't we go after him?

data.author: Luke
data.text: It's too dangerous with all the Sand People around.  We'll have to wait until morning.

data.author: Owen
data.text: Luke, I'm shutting the power down for the night.

data.author: Luke
data.text: All right, I'll be there in a few minutes.  Boy, am I gonna get it.

data.author: Luke
data.text: You know that little droid is going to cause me a lot of trouble.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Oh, he excels at that, sir.

data.author: Owen
data.text: Luke?  Luke?  Luke?  Where could he be loafing now!

data.author: Owen
data.text: Have you seen Luke this morning?

data.author: Aunt Beru
data.text: He said he had some things to do before he started today, so he left early.

data.author: Owen
data.text: Uh?  Did he take those two new droids with him?

data.author: Aunt Beru
data.text: I think so.

data.author: Owen
data.text: Well, he'd better have those units in the south range repaired bemidday or there'll be hell to pay!

data.author: Luke
data.text: How's that.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Old Ben Kenobi lives out in this direction somewhere, but I don't see how that R2 unit could have come this far.  We must have missed him.  Uncle Owen isn't going to take this very well.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Sir, would it help if you told him it was my fault.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Sure.  He needs you.  He'd probably only deactivate you for a day or so...

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Deactivate!  Well, on the other hand if you hadn't removed his restraining bolt...

data.author: Luke
data.text: Wait, there's something dead ahead on the scanner.  It looks like our droid... hit the accelerator.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Hey, whoa, just where do you think you're going?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Master Luke here is your rightful owner.  We'll have no more of this Obi-Wan Kenobi jibberish... and don't talk to me of your mission, either.  You're fortunate he doesn't blast you into a million pieces right here.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Well, come on. It's getting late.  I only hope we can get back before Uncle Owen really blows up.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: If you don't mind my saying so, sir, I think you should deactivate the little fugitive until you've gotten him back to your workshop.

data.author: Luke
data.text: No, he's not going to try anything.

data.author: Luke
data.text: What's wrong with him now?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Oh my... sir, he says there are several creatures approaching from the southeast.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Sand People!  Or worse!  Come on, let's have a look.  Come on.

data.author: Luke
data.text: There are two Banthas down there but I don't see any... wait a second, they're Sand People all right.  I can see one of them now.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Hello there!  Come here my little friend.  Don't be afraid.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Don't worry, he'll be all right.

data.author: Luke
data.text: What happened?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Rest easy, son, you've had a busy day.  You're fortunate you're still in one piece.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Ben?  Ben Kenobi!  Boy, am I glad to see you!

data.author: Ben
data.text: The Jundland Wastes are not to be traveled lightly.  Tell me, young Luke, what brings you out this far?

data.author: Luke
data.text: Oh, this little droid!  I think he's searching for his former master...  I've never seen such devotion in a droid before... there seems tobe no stopping him.  He claims to be the property of an Obi-Wan Kenobi.  Is he a relative of yours?  Do you know who he's talking about?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Obi-Wan Kenobi... Obi-Wan?  Now thats a name I haven't heard in a long time... a long time.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I think my uncle knew him.  He said he was dead.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Oh, he's not dead, no... not yet.

data.author: Luke
data.text: You know him!

data.author: Ben
data.text: Well of course, of course I know him.  He's me!  I haven't gone by the name Obi-Wan since oh, before you were born.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Then the droid does belong to you.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Don't seem to remember ever owning a droid.  Very interesting...

data.author: Ben
data.text: I think we better get indoors.  The Sand People are easily startled but they will soon be back and in greater numbers.

data.author: Luke
data.text: ... Threepio!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Where am I?  I must have taken a bad step...

data.author: Luke
data.text: Can you stand?  We've got to get out of here before the Sand People return.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I don't think I can make it.  You go on, Master Luke.  There's no sense in you risking yourself on my account.  I'm done for.

data.author: Luke
data.text: No, you're not.  What kind of talk is that?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Quickly, son... they're on the move.

data.author: Luke
data.text: No, my father didn't fight in the wars.  He was a navigator on a spice freighter.

data.author: Ben
data.text: That's what your uncle told you.  He didn't hold with your father's ideals.  Thought he should have stayed here and not gotten involved.

data.author: Luke
data.text: You fought in the Clone Wars?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Yes, I was once a Jedi Knight the same as your father.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I wish I'd known him.

data.author: Ben
data.text: He was the best star-pilot in the galaxy, and a cunning warrior.  I understand you've become quite a good pilot yourself.  And he was a good friend.  Which reminds me...

data.author: Ben
data.text: I have something here for you.  Your father wanted you to have this when you were old enough, but your uncle wouldn't allow it.  He feared you might follow old Obi-Wan on some damned-fool idealistic crusade like your father did.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Sir, if you'll not be needing me, I'll close down for awhile.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Sure, go ahead.

data.author: Luke
data.text: What is it?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Your fathers lightsaber.  This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight.  Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster.

data.author: Ben
data.text: An elegant weapon for a morecivilized time.  For over a thousand generations the Jedi Knights were the guardians of peace and justice in the Old Republic.  Before the dark times, before the Empire.

data.author: Luke
data.text: How did my father die?

data.author: Ben
data.text: A young Jedi named Darth Vader, who was a pupil of mine until he turned to evil, helped the Empire hunt down and destroy the Jedi Knights.  He betrayed and murdered your father.  Now the Jedi are all but extinct.  Vader was seduced by the dark side of the Force.

data.author: Luke
data.text: The Force?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Well, the Force is what gives the Jedi his power.  It's an energy field created by all living things.  It surrounds us and penetrates us.  It binds the galaxy together.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Now, let's see if we can't figure out what you are, my little friend.  And where you come from.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I saw part of the message he was...

data.author: Ben
data.text: I seem to have found it.

data.author: Leia
data.text: General Kenobi, years ago you served my father in the Clone Wars.  Now he begs you to help him in his struggle against the Empire.  I regret that I am unable to present my father's request to you in person, but my ship has fallen under attack and I'm afraid my mission to bring you to Alderaan has failed.  I have placed information vital to the survival of the Rebellion into the memory systems of this R2 unit.  My father will know how to retrieve it.  You must see this droid safely delivered to him on Alderaan.  This is our most desperate hour.  Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi, you're my only hope.

data.author: Ben
data.text: You must learn the ways of the Force if you're to come with me to Alderaan.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Alderaan?  I'm not going to Alderaan.  I've got to go home.  It's late, I'm in for it as it is.

data.author: Ben
data.text: I need your help, Luke.  I'm getting too old for this sort of thing.She needs your help.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I can't get involved!  I've got work to do!  It's not that I like the Empire.  I hate it!  But there's nothing I can do about it right now.  It's such a long way from here.

data.author: Ben
data.text: That's your uncle talking.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Oh, God, my uncle.  How am I ever going to explain this?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Learn about the Force, Luke.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Look, I can take you as far as Anchorhead.  You can get a transport there to Mos Eisley or wherever you're going.

data.author: Ben
data.text: You must do what you feel is right, of course.

data.author: Tagge
data.text: Until this battle station is fully operational we are vulnerable.  The Rebel Alliance is too well equipped.  They're more dangerous than you realize.

data.author: Motti
data.text: Dangerous to your starfleet, Commander

data.author: Tagge
data.text: The Rebellion will continue to gain support in the Imperial Senate as long as....

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: The Imperial Senate will no longer be of any concern to us.  I've just received word that the Emperor has dissolved the council permanently.  The last remnants of the Old Republic have been swept away.

data.author: Tagge
data.text: That's impossible!  How will the Emperor maintain control without the bureaucracy?

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: The regional governors now have direct control over territories.  Fear will keep the local systems in line.  Fear of this battle station.

data.author: Tagge
data.text: And what of the Rebellion?  If the Rebels have obtained a complete technical readout of this station, it is possible, however unlikely, that they might find a weakness and exploit it.

data.author: Vader
data.text: The plans you refer to will soon be back in our hands.

data.author: Motti
data.text: Any attack made by the Rebels against this station would be a useless gesture, no matter what technical data they've obtained.  This station is now the ultimate power in the universe.  I suggest we use it!

data.author: Vader
data.text: Don't be too proud of this technological terror you've constructed.  The ability to destroy a planet is insignificant next to the power of the Force.

data.author: Motti
data.text: Don't try to frighten us with your sorcerer's ways, Lord Vader.  Your sad devotion to that ancient religion has not helped you conjure up the stolen data tapes, or given you clairvoyance enough to find the Rebel's hidden fort...

data.author: Vader
data.text: I find your lack of faith disturbing.

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: Enough of this!  Vader, release him!

data.author: Vader
data.text: As you wish.

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: This bickering is pointless.  Lord Vader will provide us with the location of the Rebel fortress by the time this station is operational.  We will then crush the Rebellion with one swift stroke.

data.author: Luke
data.text: It looks like Sand People did this, all right.  Look, here are gaffi sticks, bantha tracks.  It's just... I never heard of them hitting anything this big before.

data.author: Ben
data.text: They didn't.  But we are meant to think they did.  These tracks are side by side.  Sand People always ride single file to hide there numbers.

data.author: Luke
data.text: These are the same Jawas that sold us Artoo and Threepio.

data.author: Ben
data.text: And these blast points, too accurate for Sand People.  Only Imperial stormtroopers are so precise.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Why would Imperial troops want to slaughter Jawas?

data.author: Luke
data.text: If they traced the robots here, they may have learned who they sold them to.  And that would lead them back home!

data.author: Ben
data.text: Wait, Luke!  It's too dangerous.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Uncle Owen!  Aunt Beru!  Uncle Owen!

data.author: Vader
data.text: And, now Your Highness, we will discuss the location of your hidden Rebel base.

data.author: Ben
data.text: There's nothing you could have done, Luke, had you been there.  You'd have been killed, too, and the droids would now be in the hands of the Empire.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I want to come with you to Alderaan.  There's nothing here for me now.  I want to learn the ways of the Force and become a Jedi like my father.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Mos Eisley Spaceport.  You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy.  We must be cautious.

data.author: Trooper
data.text: How long have you had these droids?

data.author: Luke
data.text: About three or four seasons.

data.author: Ben
data.text: They're for sale if you want them.

data.author: Trooper
data.text: Let me see your identification.

data.author: Ben
data.text: You don't need to see his identification.

data.author: Trooper
data.text: We don't need to see his identification.

data.author: Ben
data.text: looking for.

data.author: Trooper
data.text: These are not the droids we're looking for.

data.author: Ben
data.text: He can go about his business.

data.author: Trooper
data.text: You can go about your business.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Move along.

data.author: Trooper
data.text: Move along.  Move along.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I can't abide these Jawas.  Disgusting creatures.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Go on, go on.  I can't understand how we got by those troopers.  I thought we were dead.

data.author: Ben
data.text: The Force can have a strong influence on the weak-minded.  You will find it a powerful ally.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Do you really think we're going to find a pilot here that'll take us to Alderaan?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Well, most of the best freighter pilots can be found here.  Only watch your step.  This place can be a little rough.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I'm ready for anything.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Come along, Artoo.

data.author: Bartender
data.text: We don't serve their kind here!

data.author: Luke
data.text: What?

data.author: Bartender
data.text: Your droids. They'll have to wait outside.  We don't want them here.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Listen, why don't you wait out by the speeder.  We don't want any trouble.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I heartily agree with you sir.

data.author: Creature
data.text: Negola dewaghi wooldugger?!?

data.author: Human
data.text: He doesn't like you.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I'm sorry.

data.author: Human
data.text: I don't like you either

data.author: Human
data.text: Don't insult us.  You just watch yourself.  We're wanted men.  I have the death sentence on twelve systems.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I'll be careful than.

data.author: Human
data.text: You'll be dead.

data.author: Ben
data.text: This little one isn't worth the effort.  Come let me buy you something...

data.author: Bartender
data.text: No blasters!  No blaster!

data.author: Ben
data.text: This is Chewbacca.  He's first-mate on a ship that might suit our needs.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I don't like the look of this.

data.author: Han
data.text: Han Solo.  I'm captain of the Millennium Falcon.  Chewie here tells me you're looking for passage to the Alderaan system.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Yes, indeed.  If it's a fast ship.

data.author: Han
data.text: Fast ship?  You've never heard of the Millennium Falcon?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Should I have?

data.author: Han
data.text: It's the ship that made the Kessel run in less than twelve parsecs!

data.author: Han
data.text: I've outrun Imperial starships, not the local bulk-cruisers, mind you.  I'm talking about the big Corellian ships now.  She's fast enough for you, old man.  What's the cargo?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Only passengers.  Myself, the boy, two droids, and no questions asked.

data.author: Han
data.text: What is it?  Some kind of local trouble?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Let's just say we'd like to avoid any Imperial entanglements.

data.author: Han
data.text: Well, that's the real trick, isn't it?  And it's going to cost you something extra.  Ten thousand in advance.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Ten thousand?  We could almost buy our own ship for that!

data.author: Han
data.text: But who's going to fly it, kid!  You?

data.author: Luke
data.text: You bet I could.  I'm not such a bad pilot myself!  We don't have to sit here and listen...

data.author: Ben
data.text: We haven't that much with us.  But we could pay you two thousand now, plus fifteen when we reach Alderaan.

data.author: Han
data.text: Seventeen, huh!

data.author: Han
data.text: Okay.  You guys got yourself a ship.  We'll leave as soon as you're ready.  Docking bay Ninety-four.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Ninety-four.

data.author: Han
data.text: Looks like somebody's beginning to take an interest in your handiwork.

data.author: Trooper
data.text: All right, we'll check it out.

data.author: Han
data.text: Seventeen thousand!  Those guys must really be desperate.  This could really save my neck.  Get back to the ship and get her ready.

data.author: Ben
data.text: You'll have to sell your speeder.

data.author: Luke
data.text: That's okay.  I'm never coming back to this planet again.

data.author: Greedo
data.text: Going somewhere, Solo?

data.author: Han
data.text: Yes, Greedo.  As a matter of fact, I was just going to see your boss.  Tell Jabba that I've got his money.

data.author: Greedo
data.text: It's too late.  You should have paid him when you had the chance.  Jabba's put a price on your head, so large that every bounty hunter in the galaxy will be looking for you.  I'm lucky I found you first.

data.author: Han
data.text: Yeah, but this time I got the money.

data.author: Greedo
data.text: If you give it to me, I might forget I found you.

data.author: Han
data.text: I don't have it with me.  Tell Jabba...

data.author: Greedo
data.text: Jabba's through with you.  He has no time for smugglers who drop their shipments at the first sign of an Imperial cruiser.

data.author: Han
data.text: Even I get boarded sometimes.  Do you think I had a choice?

data.author: Greedo
data.text: You can tell that to Jabba.  He may only take your ship.

data.author: Han
data.text: Over my dead body.

data.author: Greedo
data.text: That's the idea I've been looking forward to killing you for a long time.

data.author: Han
data.text: Yes, I'll bet you have.

data.author: Han
data.text: Sorry about the mess.

data.author: Vader
data.text: Her resistance to the mind probe is considerable.  It will be some time before we can extract any information from her.

data.author: Imperial Officer
data.text: The final check-out is complete.  All systems are operational.  What course shall we set?

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: Perhaps she would respond to an alternative form of persuasion.

data.author: Vader
data.text: What do you mean?

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: I think it is time we demonstrate the full power of this station.Set your course for Princess Leia's home planet of Alderaan.

data.author: Trooper
data.text: With pleasure.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Lock the door, Artoo.

data.author: Trooper
data.text: All right, check that side of the street.  It's secure.  Move on to the next door.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I would much rather have gone with Master Luke than stay here with you.  I don't know what all this trouble is about, but I'm sure it must be your fault.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: You watch your language!

data.author: Luke
data.text: He says it's the best he can do.  Since the XP-38 came out, they

data.author: Ben
data.text: It will be enough.

data.author: Ben
data.text: If the ship's as fast as he's boasting, we ought to do well.

data.author: Jabba
data.text: Come on out, Solo!

data.author: Han
data.text: I've been waiting for you, Jabba.

data.author: Jabba
data.text: I expected you would be.

data.author: Han
data.text: I'm not the type to run.

data.author: Jabba
data.text: Han, my boy, there are times when you disappoint me... why haven't you paid me?  And why did you have to fry poor Greedo like that... after all we've been through together.

data.author: Han
data.text: You sent Greedo to blast me.

data.author: Jabba
data.text: Han, why you're the best smuggler in the business.  You're too valuable to fry.  He was only relaying my concern at your delays.  He wasn't going to blast you.

data.author: Han
data.text: I think he thought he was.  Next time don't send one of those twerps.  If you've got something to say to me, come see me yourself.

data.author: Jabba
data.text: Han, Han!  If only you hadn't had to dump that shipment of spice... you understand I just can't make an exception.  Where would I be if every pilot who smuggled for me dumped their shipment at the first sign of an Imperial starship?  It's not good business.

data.author: Han
data.text: You know, even I get boarded sometimes, Jabba.  I had no choice, but I've gota charter now and I can pay you back, plus a little extra.  I just need some more time.

data.author: Jabba
data.text: Put your blasters away.  Han, my boy, I'm only doing this because you're the best and I need you.  So, for an extra, say... twenty percent I'll give you a little more time... but this is it.  If you disappoint me again, I'll put a price on your head so large you won't be able to go near a civilized system for the rest of your short life.

data.author: Han
data.text: Jabba, I'll pay you because it's my pleasure.

data.author: Luke
data.text: What a piece of junk.

data.author: Han
data.text: She'll make point five beyond the speed of light.  She may not look like much, but she's got it where it counts, kid.  I've added some special modifications myself.

data.author: Han
data.text: We're a little rushed, so if you'll hurry aboard we'll get out of here.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Hello, sir.

data.author: Trooper
data.text: Which way?

data.author: Trooper
data.text: All right, men.  Load your weapons!

data.author: Trooper
data.text: Stop that ship!

data.author: Trooper
data.text: Blast 'em!

data.author: Han
data.text: Chewie, get us out of here!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Oh, my.  I'd forgotten how much I hate space travel.

data.author: Han
data.text: It looks like an Imperial cruiser.  Our passengers must be hotter than I thought.  Try and hold them off.  Angle the deflector shield while I make the calculations for the jump to light speed.

data.author: Han
data.text: Stay sharp!  There are two more coming in

data.author: Luke
data.text: Why don't you outrun them?  I thought you said this thing was fast.

data.author: Han
data.text: Watch your mouth, kid, or you're going to find yourself floating home.  We'll be safe enough once we make the jump to hyperspace.  Besides, I know a few maneuvers. We'll lose them!

data.author: Han
data.text: Here's where the fun begins!

data.author: Ben
data.text: How long before you can make the jump to light speed?

data.author: Han
data.text: It'll take a few moments to get the coordinates from the navi-computer.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Are you kidding?  At the rate they're gaining...

data.author: Han
data.text: Traveling through hyperspace isn't like dusting crops, boy!  Without precise calculations we could fly right through a star or bounce too close to a supernova and that'd end your trip real quick, wouldn't it?

data.author: Luke
data.text: What's that flashing?

data.author: Han
data.text: We're losing our deflector shield.  Go strap yourself in, I'm going to make the jump to light speed.

data.author: Motti
data.text: We've entered the Alderaan system.

data.author: Leia
data.text: Governor Tarkin, I should have expected to find you holding Vader's leash.  I recognized your foul stench when I was brought on board.

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: Charming to the last.  You don't know how hard I found it signing the order to terminate your life!

data.author: Leia
data.text: to take the responsibility yourself!

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: Princess Leia, before your execution I would like you to be my guest at a ceremony that will make this battle station operational.  No star system will dare oppose the Emperor now.

data.author: Leia
data.text: The more you tighten your grip, Tarkin, the more star systems will slip through your fingers.

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: Not after we demonstrate the power of this station.  In a way, you have determined the choice of the planet that'll be destroyed first.  Since you are reluctant to provide us with the location of the Rebel base, I have chosen to test this station's destructive power... on your home planet of Alderaan.

data.author: Leia
data.text: No!  Alderaan is peaceful.  We have no weapons.  You can't possibly...

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: You would prefer another target?  A military target?  Then name the system!

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: I grow tired of asking this.  So it'll be the last time.  Where is the Rebel base?

data.author: Leia
data.text: Dantooine.

data.author: Leia
data.text: They're on Dantooine.

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: There.  You see Lord Vader, she can be reasonable. Continue with the operation.  You may fire when ready.

data.author: Leia
data.text: What?

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: You're far too trusting.  Dantooine is too remote to make an effective demonstration.  But don't worry.  We will deal with your Rebel friends soon enough.

data.author: Leia
data.text: No!

data.author: Vader
data.text: Commence primary ignition.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Are you all right?  What's wrong?

data.author: Ben
data.text: I felt a great disturbance in the Force... as if millions of voices suddenly cried out in terror and were suddenly silenced.  I fear something terrible has happened.

data.author: Ben
data.text: You'd better get on with your exercises.

data.author: Han
data.text: Well, you can forget your troubles with those Imperial slugs.  I told you I'd outrun 'em.

data.author: Han
data.text: Don't everyone thank me at once.

data.author: Han
data.text: Anyway, we should be at Alderaan about oh-two-hundred hours.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Now be careful, Artoo.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: He made a fair move.  Screaming about it won't help you.

data.author: Han
data.text: Let him have it. It's not wise to upset a Wookiee.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: But sir, nobody worries about upsetting a droid.

data.author: Han
data.text: That's 'cause droids don't pull people's arms out of their socket when they lose.  Wookiees are known to do that.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: I see your point, sir.  I suggest a new strategy, Artoo.  Let the Wookiee win.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Remember, a Jedi can feel the Force flowing through him.

data.author: Luke
data.text: You mean it controls your actions?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Partially. But it also obeys your commands.

data.author: Han
data.text: Hokey religions and ancient weapons are no match for a good blaster at your side, kid.

data.author: Luke
data.text: You don't believe in the Force, do you?

data.author: Han
data.text: Kid, I've flown from one side of this galaxy to the other.  I've seen a lot of strange stuff, but I've never seen anything to make me believe there's one all-powerful force controlling everything.  There's no mystical energy field that controls my destiny.

data.author: Han
data.text: It's all a lot of simple tricks and nonsense.

data.author: Ben
data.text: I suggest you try it again, Luke.

data.author: Ben
data.text: This time, let go your conscious self and act on instinct.

data.author: Luke
data.text: With the blast shield down, I can't even see.  How am I supposed to fight?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Your eyes can deceive you.  Don't trust them.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Stretch out with your feelings.

data.author: Ben
data.text: You see, you can do it.

data.author: Han
data.text: I call it luck.

data.author: Ben
data.text: In my experience, there's no such thing as luck.

data.author: Han
data.text: Look, going good against remotes is one thing.  Going good against the living?  That's something else.

data.author: Han
data.text: Looks like we're coming up on Alderaan.

data.author: Luke
data.text: You know, I did feel something.  I could almost see the remote.

data.author: Ben
data.text: That's good.  You have taken your first step into a larger world.

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: Yes.

data.author: Officer Cass
data.text: Our scout ships have reached Dantooine.  They found the remains of a Rebel base, but they estimate that it has been deserted for some time.  They are now conducting an extensive search of the surrounding systems.

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: She lied!  She lied to us!

data.author: Vader
data.text: I told you she would never consciously betray the Rebellion.

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: Terminate her... immediately!

data.author: Han
data.text: Stand by, Chewie, here we go.  Cut in the sublight engines.

data.author: Han
data.text: What the...?  Aw, we've come out of hyperspace into a meteor shower.  Some kind of asteroid collision.  It's not on any of the charts.

data.author: Luke
data.text: What's going on?

data.author: Han
data.text: Our position is correct, except... no, Alderaan!

data.author: Luke
data.text: What do you mean?  Where is it?

data.author: Han
data.text: Thats what I'm trying to tell you, kid.  It ain't there.  It's been totally blown away.

data.author: Luke
data.text: What?  How?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Destroyed... by the Empire!

data.author: Han
data.text: The entire starfleet couldn't destroy the whole planet.  It'd take a thousand ships with more fire power than I've...

data.author: Han
data.text: There's another ship coming in.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Maybe they know what happened.

data.author: Ben
data.text: It's an Imperial fighter.

data.author: Luke
data.text: It followed us!

data.author: Ben
data.text: No.  It's a short range fighter.

data.author: Han
data.text: There aren't any bases around here.  Where did it come from?

data.author: Luke
data.text: It sure is leaving in a big hurry.  If they identify us, we're in big trouble.

data.author: Han

data.text: When we heard about Alderaan, we were afraid that you were... lost along with your father.

data.author: Leia
data.text: We don't have time for our sorrows, commander.  The battle station has surely tracked us here.It's the only explanation for the ease of our escape.  You must use the information in this R2 unit to plan the attack.  It is our only hope.

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: Yes.

data.author: Death star intercom Voice
data.text: We are approaching the planet Yavin.  The Rebel base is on a moon on the far side.  We are preparing to orbit the planet.

data.author: Dodonna
data.text: The battle station is heavily shielded and carries a firepower greater than half the star fleet.Its defenses are designed around a direct large-scale assault.  A small one-man fighter should be able to penetrate the outer defense.

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: Pardon me for asking, sir, but what good are snub fighters going to be against that?

data.author: Dodonna
data.text: Well, the Empire doesn't consider a small one-man fighter to be any threat, or they'd have a tighter defense.  An analysis of the plans provided by Princess Leia has demonstrated a weakness in the battle station.

data.author: Dodonna
data.text: The approach will not be easy.  You are required to maneuver straight down this trench and skim the surface to this point.  The target area is only two meters wide.  It's a small thermal exhaust port, right below the main port.  The shaft leads directly to the reactor system.  A precise hit will start a chain reaction which should destroy the station.

data.author: Dodonna
data.text: Only a precise hit will set up a chain reaction.  The shaft is ray-shielded, so you'll have to use proton torpedoes.

data.author: Wedge
data.text: That's impossible, even for a computer.

data.author: Luke
data.text: It's not impossible.  I used to bullseye womp rats in my T-sixteen back home.  They're not much bigger than two meters.

data.author: Dodonna
data.text: Man your ships!  And may the Force be with you!

data.author: Death star intercom Voice
data.text: Orbiting the planet at maximum velocity.  The moon with the Rebel base will be in range in thirty minutes.

data.author: Vader
data.text: This will be a day long remembered.  It has seen the end of Kenobi and it will soon see the end of the Rebellion.

data.author: Man
data.text: All flight troops, man your stations.  All flight troops, man your stations.

data.author: Luke
data.text: So... you got your reward and you're just leaving then?

data.author: Han
data.text: That's right, yeah!  I got some old debts I've got to pay off with this stuff.  Even if I didn't, you don't think I'd be fool enough to stick around here, do you?  Why don't you come with us?  You're pretty good in a fight.  I could use you.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Come on!  Why don't you take a look around?  You know what's about to happen, what they're up against.  They could use a good pilot like you.  You're turning your back on them.

data.author: Han
data.text: What good's a reward if you ain't around to use it?  Besides, attacking that battle station ain'tmy idea of courage.  It's more like suicide.

data.author: Luke
data.text: All right.  Well, take care of yourself, Han... guess that's what you're best at, isn't it?

data.author: Han
data.text: Hey, Luke... may the Force be with you!

data.author: Han
data.text: What're you lookin' at?  I know what I'm doing.

data.author: Leia
data.text: What's wrong?

data.author: Luke
data.text: Oh, it's Han!  I don't know, I really thought he'd change his mind.

data.author: Leia
data.text: He's got to follow his own path.  No one can choose it for him.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I only wish Ben were here.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Luke!  I don't believe it!  How'd you get here... are you going out with us?!

data.author: Luke
data.text: Biggs!  Of course, I'll be up there with you!  Listen, have I got some stories to tell...

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Are you... Luke Skywalker?  Have you been checked out on the Incom T-sixty-five?

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Sir, Luke is the best bushpilot in the outer rim territories.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: I met your father once when I was just a boy.  He was a great pilot.  You'll do all right.  If you've got half of your father's skill, you'll do better than all right.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Thank you, sir.  I'll try.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: I've got to get aboard.  Listen, you'll tell me your stories when we come back.  All right?

data.author: Luke
data.text: I told you I'd make it someday, Biggs.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: You did, all right.  It's going to be like old times Luke. We're a couple of shooting stars that'll never be stopped!

data.author: Chief
data.text: This R2 unit of your seems a bit beat up.  Do you want a new one?

data.author: Luke
data.text: Not on your life!  That little droid and I have been through a lot together.You okay, Artoo?

data.author: Chief
data.text: Okay, easy she goes!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Hang on tight, Artoo, you've got to come back.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: You wouldn't want my life to get boring, would you?

data.author: Ben
data.text: Luke, the Force will be with you.

data.author: Massassi intercom Voice
data.text: Stand-by alert.  Death Star approaching.  Estimated time to firing range, fifteen minutes.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: All wings report in.

data.author: Red Ten
data.text: Red Ten standing by.

data.author: Red Seven
data.text: Red Seven standing by.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Red Three standing by.

data.author: Porkins
data.text: Red Six standing by.

data.author: Red Nine
data.text: Red Nine standing by.

data.author: Wedge
data.text: Red Two standing by.

data.author: Red Eleven
data.text: Red Eleven standing by.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Red Five standing by.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Lock S-foils in attack position.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: We're passing through their magnetic field.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Hold tight!

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Switch your deflectors on.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Double front!

data.author: Wedge
data.text: Look at the size of that thing!

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Cut the chatter, Red Two.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Accelerate to attack speed.  This is it, boys!

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: Red Leader, this is Gold Leader.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: I copy, Gold Leader.

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: We're starting for the target shaft now.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: We're in position.  I'm going to cut across the axis and try and draw their fire.

data.author: Wedge
data.text: Heavy fire, boss!  Twenty-threedegrees.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: I see it.  Stay low.

data.author: Luke
data.text: This is Red Five!  I'm going in!

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Luke, pull up!

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Are you all right?

data.author: Luke
data.text: I got a little cooked, but I'm okay.

data.author: Astro-Officer
data.text: We count thirty Rebel ships, Lord Vader.  But they're so small they're evading our turbo-lasers!

data.author: Vader
data.text: We'll have to destroy them ship to ship.  Get the crews to their fighters.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Luke, let me know when you're going in.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I'm on my way in now...

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Watch yourself!  There's a lot of fire coming from the right side of that deflection tower.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I'm on it.

data.author: Control Officer
data.text: Squad leaders, we've picked up a new group of signals.  Enemy fighters coming your way.

data.author: Luke
data.text: My scope's negative.  I don't see anything.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Keep up your visual scanning.  With all this jamming, they'll be on top of you before your scope can pick them up.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Biggs!  You've picked one up... watch it!

data.author: Biggs
data.text: I can't see it!  Where is he?!

data.author: Biggs
data.text: He's on me tight, I can't shake him... I can't shake him.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Hang on, Biggs, I'm coming in.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Got him!

data.author: Vader
data.text: Several fighters have broken off from the main group.  Come with me!

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Pull in!  Luke... pull in!

data.author: Wedge
data.text: Watch your back, Luke!

data.author: Wedge
data.text: Watch your back!  Fighter's above you, coming in!

data.author: Luke
data.text: I'm hit, but not bad.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Artoo, see what you can do with it.  Hang on back there.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Red Six...

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Can you see Red Five?

data.author: Red Ten
data.text: There's a heavy fire zone on this side. Red Five, where are you?

data.author: Luke
data.text: I can't shake him!

data.author: Wedge
data.text: I'm on him, Luke!

data.author: Wedge
data.text: Hold on!

data.author: Luke
data.text: Blast it!  Wedge where are you?

data.author: Luke
data.text: Thanks, Wedge.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Good shooting, Wedge!

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: Red Leader...

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: ... This is Gold Leader.  We're starting out attack run.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: I copy, Gold Leader.  Move into position.

data.author: Vader
data.text: Stay in attack formation!

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: The exhaust post is...

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: ... marked and locked in!

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: Switch power to front deflection screens.

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: How many guns do you think, Gold Five?

data.author: Gold Five
data.text: I'd say about twenty guns.  Some on the surface, some on the towers.

data.author: Massassi intercom Voice
data.text: Death Star will be in range in five minutes.

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: Switch to targeting computer.

data.author: Gold Two
data.text: Computer's locked.  Getting a signal.

data.author: Gold Two
data.text: The guns... they've stopped!

data.author: Gold Five
data.text: Stabilize your rear deflectors.  Watch for enemy fighters.

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: They've coming in!  Three marks at two ten.

data.author: Vader
data.text: I'll take them myself!  Cover me!

data.author: Wingman
data.text: Yes, sir.

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: I can't maneuver!

data.author: Gold Five
data.text: Stay on target.

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: We're too close.

data.author: Gold Five
data.text: Stay on target!

data.author: Gold Leader
data.text: Loosen up!

data.author: Gold Five
data.text: Gold Five to Red Leader...

data.author: Gold Five
data.text: Lost Tiree, lost Dutch.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: I copy, Gold Five.

data.author: Gold Five
data.text: They came from behind....

data.author: Officer
data.text: We've analyzed their attack, sir, and there is a danger.  Should I have your ship standing by?

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: Evacuate?  In out moment of triumph?  I think you overestimate their chances!

data.author: Voice
data.text: Rebel base, three minutes and closing.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Red Group, this is Red Leader.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Rendezvous at mark six point one.

data.author: Wedge
data.text: This is Red Two.  Flying towards you.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Red Three, standing by.

data.author: Dodonna
data.text: Red Leader, this is Base One.  Keep half your group out of range for the next run.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Copy, Base One.  Luke, take Red Two and Three.  Hold up here and wait for my signal... to start your run.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: This is it!

data.author: Red Ten
data.text: We should be able to see it by now.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Keep your eyes open for those fighters!

data.author: Red Ten
data.text: There's too much interference!

data.author: Red Ten
data.text: Red Five, can you see them from where you are?

data.author: Luke
data.text: No sign of any... wait!

data.author: Luke
data.text: Coming in point three five.

data.author: Red Ten
data.text: I see them.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: I'm in range.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Target's coming up!

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Just hold them off for a few seconds.

data.author: Vader
data.text: Close up formation.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Almost there!

data.author: Red Ten
data.text: You'd better let her loose.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Almost there!

data.author: Red Ten
data.text: I can't hold them!

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: It's away!

data.author: Red Nine
data.text: It's a hit!

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Negative.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Negative!  It didn't go in, it just impacted on the surface.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Red Leader, we're right above you.  Turn to point...

data.author: Luke
data.text: ... oh-five

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Stay there...

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: ... I just lost my starboard engine.

data.author: Red Leader
data.text: Get set up for your attack run.

data.author: Death star intercom Voice
data.text: Rebel base, one minute and closing.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Biggs, Wedge, let's close it up.  We're going in.  We're going in full throttle.

data.author: Wedge
data.text: Right with you, boss.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Luke, at that speed will you be able to pull out in time?

data.author: Luke
data.text: It'll be just like Beggar's Canyon back home.

data.author: Biggs
data.text: We'll stay back far enough to cover you.

data.author: Wedge
data.text: My scope shows the tower, but I can't see the exhaust port!  Are you sure the computer can hit it?

data.author: Luke
data.text: Watch yourself!  Increase speed full throttle!

data.author: Wedge
data.text: What about that tower?

data.author: Luke
data.text: You worry about those fighters!  I'll worry about the tower!

data.author: Luke
data.text: Artoo... that, that stabilizer's broken loose again!  See if you can't lock it down!

data.author: Wedge
data.text: I'm hit!  I can't stay with you.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Get clear, Wedge.

data.author: Luke
data.text: You can't do any more good back there!

data.author: Wedge
data.text: Sorry!

data.author: Vader
data.text: Let him go!  Stay on the leader!

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Hurry, Luke, they're coming in much faster this time. I can't hold them!

data.author: Luke
data.text: Artoo, try and increase the power!

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Hurry up, Luke!

data.author: Biggs
data.text: Wait!

data.author: Death star intercom Voice
data.text: Rebel base, thirty seconds and closing.

data.author: Vader
data.text: I'm on the leader.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Hang on, Artoo!

data.author: Ben
data.text: Use the Force, Luke.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Let go, Luke.

data.author: Vader
data.text: The Force is strong with this one!

data.author: Ben
data.text: Luke, trust me.

data.author: Base Voice
data.text: His computer's off.  Luke, you switched off your targeting computer.  What's wrong?

data.author: Luke
data.text: Nothing.  I'm all right.

data.author: Luke
data.text: I've lost Artoo!

data.author: Massassi intercom Voice
data.text: The Death Star has cleared the planet.  The Death Star has cleared the planet.

data.author: Death star intercom Voice
data.text: Rebel base, in range.

data.author: Tarkin
data.text: You may fire when ready.

data.author: Death star intercom Voice
data.text: Commence primary ignition.

data.author: Vader
data.text: I have you now.

data.author: Vader
data.text: What?

data.author: Han
data.text: Yahoo!

data.author: Wingman
data.text: Look out!

data.author: Han
data.text: You're all clear, kid.

data.author: Han
data.text: Now let's blow this thing and go home!

data.author: Intercom Voice
data.text: Stand by to fire at Rebel base.

data.author: Intercom Voice
data.text: Standing by.

data.author: Han
data.text: Great shot, kid.  That was one in a million.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Remember, the Force will be with you... always.

data.author: Leia
data.text: Luke!  Luke!  Luke!

data.author: Han
data.text: Hey!  Hey!

data.author: Luke
data.text: I knew you'd come back!  I just knew it!

data.author: Han
data.text: Well, I wasn't gonna let you get all the credit and take all the reward.

data.author: Leia
data.text: Hey, I knew there was more to you than money.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Oh, no!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Oh, my!  Artoo!  Can you hear me?  Say something!You can repair him, can't you?

data.author: Technician
data.text: We'll get to work on him right away.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: You must repair him!  Sir, if any of my circuits or gears will help, I'll gladly donate them.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Echo Three to Echo Seven. Han, old buddy, do you  read me?

data.author: Han
data.text: Loud and clear, kid. What's up?

data.author: Luke
data.text: Well, I finished my circle. I don't pick up any  life readings.

data.author: Han
data.text: There isn't enough life on this ice cube to fill a  space cruiser. The sensors are placed. I'm going back.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Right. I'll see you shortly. There's a meteorite  that hit the ground near here. I want to check it out. It won't take long.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Hey, steady girl. What's the matter? You smell something?

data.author: Luke
data.text: Aaargh!

data.author: Han
data.text: Chewie!

data.author: Han
data.text: All right, don't lose your temper. I'll come right back and give  you a hand.

data.author: Rieekan
data.text: Solo?

data.author: Han
data.text: No sign of life out there, General. The sensors are in place.  You'll know if anything comes around.

data.author: Rieekan
data.text: Commander Skywalker reported in yet?

data.author: Han
data.text: No. He's checking out a meteorite that hit near him.

data.author: Rieekan
data.text: With all the meteor activity in this  system, it's going to be difficult to spot approaching ships.

data.author: Han
data.text: General, I've got to leave. I can't stay anymore.

data.author: Rieekan
data.text: I'm sorry to hear that.

data.author: Han
data.text: Well, there's a price on my head. If I don't pay off Jabba the  Hut, I'm a dead man.

data.author: Rieekan
data.text: A death mark's not an easy thing to live with. You're a good  fighter, Solo. I hate to lose you.

data.author: Han
data.text: Thank you, General.

data.author: Han
data.text: Well, Your Highness, I guess this is it.

data.author: Leia
data.text: That's right.

data.author: Han
data.text: Well, don't get all mushy on me. So long, Princess.

data.author: Leia
data.text: Han!

data.author: Han
data.text: Yes, Your Highnessness?

data.author: Leia
data.text: I thought you decided to stay.

data.author: Han
data.text: Well, the bounty hunter we ran into on Ord Mantell changed my  mind.

data.author: Leia
data.text: Han, we need you!

data.author: Han
data.text: We?

data.author: Leia
data.text: Yes.

data.author: Han
data.text: Oh, what about you need?

data.author: Leia
data.text: I need? I don't know what you're talking about.

data.author: Han
data.text: You probably don't.

data.author: Leia
data.text: And what precisely am I supposed to know?

data.author: Han
data.text: Come on! You want me to stay because of the way you feel about  me.

data.author: Leia
data.text: Yes. You're a great help to us. You're a natural leader...

data.author: Han
data.text: No! That's not it. Come on. Aahhh -- uh huh! Come on.

data.author: Leia
data.text: You're imagining things.

data.author: Han
data.text: Am I? Then why are you following me? Afraid I was going to leave  without giving you a goodbye kiss?

data.author: Leia
data.text: I'd just as soon kiss a Wookiee.

data.author: Han
data.text: I can arrange that. You could use a good kiss!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Don't try to blame me. I didn't ask you to turn on the  thermal heater. I merely commented that it was freezing in the princess's chamber. But it's supposed to be freezing. How are we going to dry out all her clothes? I really don't know.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Oh, switch off.

data.author: Han
data.text: Why do you take this apart now? I'm trying to get us  out of here and you pull both of these.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Excuse me, sir.

data.author: Han
data.text: Put them back together right now.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Might I have a word with you, please?

data.author: Han
data.text: What do you want?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Well, it's Princess Leia, sir. She's been trying to get you  on the communicator.

data.author: Han
data.text: I turned it off. I don't want to talk to her.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Oh. Well, Princess Leia is wondering about Master Luke. He  hasn't come back yet. She doesn't know where he is.

data.author: Han
data.text: I don't know where he is.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Nobody knows where he is.

data.author: Han
data.text: What do you mean, \"nobody knows\"?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Well, uh, you see...

data.author: Han
data.text: Deck Officer. Deck Officer!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Excuse me, sir. Might I inqu-...

data.author: Deck Officer
data.text: Yes, sir?

data.author: Han
data.text: Do you know where Commander Skywalker is?

data.author: Deck Officer
data.text: I haven't seen him. It's possible he came in through the  south entrance.

data.author: Han
data.text: It's possible? Why don't you go find out? It's getting dark out  there.

data.author: Deck Officer
data.text: Yes, sir.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Excuse me, sir. Might I inquire what's going on?

data.author: Han
data.text: Why not?

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Impossible man. Come along, Artoo, lets find Princess Leia.  Between ourselves, I think Master Luke is in considerable danger.

data.author: Deck Officer
data.text: Sir, Commander Skywalker hasn't come in through the  south entrance. He might have forgotten to check in.

data.author: Han
data.text: Not likely. Are the speeders ready?

data.author: Deck Officer
data.text: Not yet. We're having some trouble adapting them to the  cold.

data.author: Han
data.text: Then we'll have to go out on Tauntauns.

data.author: Deck Officer
data.text: Sir, the temperature's dropping too rapidly.

data.author: Han
data.text: That's right. And my friends out in it.

data.author: Assistant Officer
data.text: I'll cover sector twelve. Have com-control set  screen alpha.

data.author: Deck Officer
data.text: Your Tauntaun'll freeze before you reach the first  marker.

data.author: Han
data.text: Then I'll see you in hell!

data.author: Threepio
data.text: You must come along now, Artoo. There's really nothing more  we can do. And my joints are freezing up.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Don't say thing like that! Of course we'll see Master Luke  again. He'll be quite all right, you'll see.  Stupid little short-circuit. He'll be quite all right.

data.author: Lieutenant
data.text: Sir, all the patrols are in. There's still no contact from  Skywalker or Solo.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Mistress Leia, Artoo says he's been quite unable to pick up  any signals, although he does admit that his own range is far too weak to abandon all hope.

data.author: Derlin
data.text: Your Highness, there's nothing more we can do tonight. The  shield doors must be closed.

data.author: Derlin
data.text: Close the doors.

data.author: Lieutenant
data.text: Yes, sir.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Artoo says the chances of survival are seven hundred  seventy-five...to one.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Actually, Artoo has been known to make mistakes...from time  to time. Oh, dear, oh, dear. Don't worry about Master Luke. I'm sure he'll be all right. He's quite clever, you know...for a human being.

data.author: Ben
data.text: Luke...Luke.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Ben?

data.author: Ben
data.text: You will go to the Dagobah system.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Dagobah system?

data.author: Ben
data.text: There you will learn from Yoda, the Jedi Master who instructed  me.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Ben...Ben.

data.author: Han
data.text: Luke! Luke! Don't do this, Luke. Come on, give me a sign here.

data.author: Han
data.text: Not much time.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Ben...Ben...

data.author: Han
data.text: Hang on, kid.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Dagobah system...

data.author: Han
data.text: Whew...

data.author: Luke
data.text: Dagobah...

data.author: Han
data.text: This may smell bad, kid...

data.author: Luke
data.text: Yoda...

data.author: Han
data.text: ...but it will keep you warm...til I get the shelter built.   Ooh...I thought they smelled bad on the outside!

data.author: Zev
data.text: Echo Base...I've got something! Not much, but  it could be a life form.

data.author: Zev
data.text: This is Rouge Two. this is Rouge Two. Captain  Solo, so you copy? Commander Skywalker, do you copy? This is Rouge Two.

data.author: Han
data.text: Good morning. Nice of you guys to  drop by.

data.author: Zev
data.text: Echo Base...this is Rouge Two. I found  them. Repeat, I found them.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Master Luke, sir, it's good to see you fully functional  again.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Artoo expresses his relief, also.

data.author: Han
data.text: How are you feeling, kid? You don't look so bad to me. In fact,  you look strong enough to pull the ears off a Gundark.

data.author: Luke
data.text: Thanks to you.

data.author: Han
data.text: That's two you owe me, junior.

data.author: Han
data.text: Well your Worship, looks like you managed to keep me around for a  little while longer.

data.author: Leia
data.text: I had nothing to do with it. General Rieekan thinks  it's dangerous for any ships to leave the system until we've activated the energy shield.

data.author: Han
data.text: That's a good story. I think you just can't bear to let a  gorgeous guy like me out of your sight.

data.author: Leia
data.text: I don't know where you get you delusions, laser brain.

data.author: Han
data.text: Laugh it up, fuzz ball. But you didn't see us alone in the south  passage.

data.author: Han
data.text: She expressed her true feelings for me.

data.author: Leia
data.text: My...! Why, you stuck up,...half-witted,...scruffy-looking...  nerf-herder!

data.author: Han
data.text: Who's scruffy-looking?  I must have hit her pretty close  to the mark to get her all riled up like that, huh, kid?

data.author: Leia
data.text: Why, I guess you don't know everything about women yet?

data.author: Announcer
data.text: Headquarters personnel, report to command  center.

data.author: Han
data.text: Take it easy.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Excuse us, please.

data.author: Rieekan
data.text: Princess...we have a visitor.

data.author: Rieekan
data.text: We've picked up something outside the base in zone twelve,  moving east.

data.author: Senior Controller
data.text: It's metal.

data.author: Leia
data.text: Then it couldn't be one of those creatures that attacked Luke.

data.author: Han
data.text: It could be a speeder, one of ours.

data.author: Senior Controller
data.text: No. Wait -- there's something very weak coming  through.

data.author: Threepio
data.text: Sir, I am fluent in six million forms of communication. This  signal is not used by the Alliance. It could be an Imperial code.

data.author: Han
